summary:
I'm an experienced CELTA certified Native English Teacher having taught for 13 years with 5000 hours + EFL teaching experience, which includes 4 years at Universities. I help students improve their English language skills. Since November 2011, I've owned my own company: D.I. Linguistic Solutions. Born in London, I'm a native speaker.  Nowadays, I live and work in the Netherlands. I've taught international students from 4-92 years old, ranging from A1-C2. Also, I've been offering correction work services since 2011.

I have given teacher training workshops for teachers on presentation skills, creativity and teacher talking time. I have also taught two teacher training courses (ROC Mondriaan, Hotelschool). In February 2018 I passed DELTA module 1, which focuses on understanding language, methodology and resources for teaching.

I wrote, edited & independently published The EFL Teacher's Handbook in 2017 ( http://a.co/0UHVMnv), and, a year later, The EFL Teacher's Companion (http://a.co/eZN2ped) and EFL Resources: 20 Writing Assignments (http://a.co/d/dpkLSqJ). The latest teaching-related enterprise is EFL Blogs (2019). I'm also a blogger for iamexpat.nl and contributor for EFL Magazine.

Following on from my film background, I wrote and self-published: Top 100 Films: Film Criticism, Trivia and Lists (2020). In addition - as a homage to Jack Kerouac (1922-1969), one of my favourite writers, and in keeping with one of my great passions, which is travelling, I have also written and self-published World Traveller (2020) and film-related: Catharsis (2021), Homage (2022) and Do I Amuse You? (2023)

Teaching: I give Business English lessons: online, in-house/ in-company, and Cambridge examining is on the side.  

I have also facilitated Effective Business Communication at Erasmus University, taught Academic English (EAP), English for Biomedical Sciences, Academic English for the Sciences (AES) and the Social Sciences, Writing for Publication for highly motivated BA / MA students at the University of Utrecht, and EAP & General English at University of Leiden in Den Haag and Leiden.

Additionally, I've helped students privately with exam preparation (B2 First and C1 Advanced), taught General English at various centres, at SWOP, I taught senior citizens integrated skills for over 5 years, private lessons for 6, and, lastly, I taught teenagers exam preparation classes at Winford college.

Specialities: 

* Personal approach
* Great communication skills
* Humour
* Creativity 
* Enthusiasm
* Creating courses
* Designing material

profile_positions.title: Senior English Teacher

profile_positions.description:
* As the owner, I plan and teach lessons, teach teachers, do admin, correction-work and examine for Cambridge.. 
* I offer custom-made English lessons for adult learners from any background/ level. 
* I give lessons in Business & General English, integrated skills and exam prep (B2 First, BEC). 
* I have worked in Amsterdam, The Hague, Rotterdam and Utrecht. Lessons are online & f2f.
* I help students to improve pronunciation, freshen up grammar or improve their writing, so they are well prepared for work, study or conversations in an environment where English is the medium.
* I've taught students from a variety of professions, from general practitioner to jeweller to engineer, and from civil servant and surgeon to weapon systems specialist.
* All lessons are tailor-made and adapted to suit the specific needs, capacities and personal situation of the students.
* I taught Effective Business Communication as facilitator at Erasmus University.
* I also taught English for Specific Purposes, English for the Social Sciences, Writing for Publication (for Scientists) & English for the Sciences (Biomedical). 
*I taught English for Academic Purposes, which covered presentations & writing for Leiden University  and presenting and writing for University of Utrecht.
* In summary: Custom-Made, Integrated Skills, General English, Business Communication Skills, Business English, EAP, BEC/ CAE/ FCE Exam prep, English for the Sciences, Writing for Publication.
* I've taught sts from: Afghanistan, Argentina, Aruba, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bosnia, Brazil, Bulgaria, Chile, China, Croatia, Curaçao, Eire, England, Ethiopia, Finland, France, Germany, Ghana, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Iran, Iraq, Italy, Japan, Kazakhstan, Latvia, Macedonia, Madagascar, Morocco,  Netherlands, Pakistan, Panama, Peru, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russia, Serbia, Slovakia, South Korea, Spain, Sri Lanka, Suriname, Sweden, Switzerland, Syria, Tunisia, Turkey, Ukraine, Venezuela,Vietnam.
profile_positions.title: Senior English Teacher & Owner

profile_positions.description:
* Wrote, edited and self-publised Do I Amuse You? (2023), a feature length comedy screenplay via Amazon.
* Wrote, edited and self-published Homage, a feature length screenplay and tribute to Jean-Pierre-Melville via Amazon.
* Wrote, edited and self-published Catharsis, an original screenplay (2021) via Amazon.
* Wrote, edited and self-published: World Traveller (2020), a nod to Jack Kerouac (1922-69) via Amazon.
* Wrote, edited and self-published: Top 100 Films: Film Criticism, Trivia and Lists (2020) via Amazon.
* Wrote, edited and independently published EFL Blogs (2019) via Amazon.
* Wrote, edited and independently published EFL Resources: 20 Writing Assignments (2018) via Amazon.
* Wrote, edited and independently published The EFL Teacher's Companion (2018) via Amazon. 
* Wrote, edited and independently published The EFL Teacher's Handbook (2017) via Amazon.
* Giving interviews: a Language Company MD, 2 DELTA teachers, a DELTA Teacher Trainer, a CELTA Teacher Trainer, a NNE teacher, 2 Teacher Trainers, a Student, a Teachers' Union Boss, linguistic heavyweights: David Crystal, Scott Thornbury, Diane Larsen-Freeman, Penny Ur & Michael Swan, as well as CEO of Cambridge assessment Saul Nassé.
* Website development (April 2017-April 2019), linking websites to EFL resource sites, promotional (posts, pictures, social media, updates and videos), sponsored advertising (Facebook page) and contacting potential leads (readers who liked posts, language centre and libraries).

* The first book has been sold to three language centres and a public library in the Hague. It is now on the shelves of the premier library in Amsterdam (OBA), one language centre in Ankara, Turkey, a research library in Germany and has also been sold in Brazil, the USA, the UK, the Netherlands and more.
* EFL Magazine Contributor 
* Prolific writer of short articles on LinkedIn 
* Being interviewed, i.e. Teacher to Teacherpreneur (Canadian site)
* Guest blog -  Teach-In Education (Brazilian site)
profile_positions.title: Writer, Editor and Self-Publisher

profile_positions.description:
* Lost in translation? I do correction work for students, academics and professionals who want to avoid annoying linguistic mistakes in their English essays, theses, articles, presentations and speeches. 

Some notable examples of this work:

* Corrected a Masters Thesis about the use of allegory and symbolism in the work of Wordsworth and Baudelaire.

* Edited a law paper on the Russian legal system.

* Edited two papers that were to be submitted to a nursing journal.

* During a lesson, I helped a civil servant edit his speech before it was to be presented to the Dutch ambassador in India.

* In summary, I have edited papers that cover the following areas: agriculture, archaeology, architecture, bio-medical sciences, business management, clinical sciences, computer science, earth science, English literature, engineering policy analysis, gender studies, geography, history of art, international studies, job coaching, law, marine biology, musicology, physiotherapy, politics, psychology and water management.
profile_positions.title: English correction work

profile_positions.description:
* I gave private lessons to individuals for almost eight years; first independently (see seperate entry March 2010-Nov 2011), and since November 2011, for my company: D.I. Linguistic Solutions.
* Courses were tailor-made and focused on such areas as CAE preparation, conversation practice, IELTS preparation, pronunciation, integrated skills, reading and writing.
* I taught private students in Amsterdam, Den Haag, Leiden, Pijnacker and Wassenaar.
* The occupations of the students were varied: from real estate developer to engineer, from a financial director to the owner of an estate agency, a refugee, a translator and a shell employee.
* The nationalities of these students were also  varied: from Afghanistan, Brazil, France, Hungary, the Netherlands, Spain, Syria and Turkey.

volunteer_experiences.description:
* Writing anecdotes about my teaching adventures in the Netherlands for a successful online educational magazine.
* Writing about serious issues regarding the treatment of high school teachers in the Netherlands and all over the world.
* Interviewing interesting industry professionals such as Harald Kruithof of Language Partners. NB: 'Fancy a New Challenge', a DELTA Module 1 survival guide, 'False Friends in the Dutch and Spanish Classroom' and 'Some Tips on using Storytelling in the EFL Classroom' are a few of the more recent pieces. These articles originally appeared as 'Interview with the Managing Director of a Language Company' and 'DELTA Module 1: a survival guide' in The EFL Teacher's Companion while 'False Friends: a phenomenal phenomenon' and 'How to Use Stories in EFL Lessons' featured in The EFL Teacher's Handbook.
* The reader is likely to be a business owner, DOS, teacher, teaching assistant, college lecturer, publisher, student, writer and author.
* See link: https://www.eflmagazine.com/author/daniel-israel/

* Independent Travel: North, Central and South America, Europe, North Africa, South, South East and East Asia.
* Honeymoon in India and 22 other countries with my wife
* 54 countries visited altogether
* Chief organiser and planner of all trips for 22 years
*  Favourite places: Cartagena des Indias, Salvador de Bahia, Tokyo, Marrakesh, New Orleans, Vancouver, Amsterdam, London, Paris and Berlin.
* Author of World Traveller (2020) - which adopts the style of the beat generation writer Jack Kerouac (1922-1969) -  covering 52 countries across 5 continents - it begins as creative fiction for earlier memories - and then transforms into a travel autobiography for more lucid recollections.
* Author of Travel Blogs such as Independent Traveller: short poems and stories, Wanderlust (parts 1 and 2, 2016), World Traveller: 20 years of Travel Stories (2016), Wanderlust Revisited (2019), Culture Shock (2020), Travelling During the Pandemic & Not So Lonesome Traveller (2021), Are you a Tourist or a Traveller? And Why Is Travelling Far Away Good for the Soul? (2022)

skills: Teaching English as a Second Language
